greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) (n>=0, 1<=k<=n+1) read by rows: T(n,1)=1 for n>=0, T(1,2)=2. If n>=3 is odd then T(n,k)=1 for all k. If n>=3 is even then if k is prime and k-1 divides n then T(n,k)=k, otherwise T(n,k)=1.
comment: By the von Stadt-Clausen theorem, the product of the terms in row n is the denominator of the Bernoulli number B_n.
reference: H. Rademacher, Topics in Analytic Number Theory, Springer, 1973, Chap. 1.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ & _Mats Granvik_, Aug 09 2008
ext: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 10 2019
